snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown’s water rationing order came too late, say festival organizers, for them to make adjustments for hundreds of thousands of festivalgoers.
abstract: Coachella music festival in Indio, Calif, has made few adjustments to its water use policy in face of statewide drought, as Gov Jerry Brown's order to reduce water use by 25 percent was issued after festival plans were already in place; festival features fountains, pools and expanses of green lawn.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown’s water rationing order came too late, say festival organizers, for them to make adjustments for hundreds of thousands of festivalgoers.
